title: Problem Overview
content: Erdős Problem #473 asks for a permutation of positive integers where consecutive sums are always prime. SOLVED by Odlyzko. The greedy algorithm works but misses some primes (like 197) as sums.

title: Permutation of Positive Integers
content: A bijection from ℕ+ to ℕ+. The sequence must include every positive integer exactly once.

title: Prime Sum Property
content: Every consecutive sum a_k + a_{k+1} is prime. This is the main constraint on the permutation.

title: Segal's Question
content: The main question: does there exist a permutation of positive integers with all consecutive sums prime?

title: Odlyzko's Theorem
content: There exists such a permutation. The answer to Segal's question is YES. Odlyzko's proof is unpublished.

title: Greedy Sequence
content: The greedy algorithm: a₁ = 1, a_{n+1} = min{x : a_n + x is prime and x not used}. Always produces prime sums by construction.

title: Greedy Has Prime Sums
content: The greedy sequence satisfies the prime sum property by construction - each next element is chosen specifically to make the sum prime.

title: Greedy Coverage (OPEN)
content: Does the greedy sequence include every positive integer? This remains an open question.

title: Van Doorn's Observation
content: The prime 197 never appears as a consecutive sum in the greedy sequence. Not all primes appear as sums.

title: Finite Version
content: For n ≥ 2, can {1,...,n} be arranged so consecutive sums are prime? Likely true for all n, confirmed for infinitely many.

title: Prime Sum Graph
content: The graph where vertices are positive integers and edges connect i,j when i+j is prime. The problem asks for a Hamilton path in this graph.

title: Parity Constraint
content: For a + b to be an odd prime (> 2), exactly one of a, b must be even. This constrains the permutation structure significantly.

title: Greedy Initial Values
content: The greedy sequence begins: 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 6, 5, 8, 9, ... with consecutive sums 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 11, 13, 17, ...

title: Main Result
content: erdos_473_main: Existence of prime sum permutation (Odlyzko), greedy has prime sums, 197 missing from greedy, finite version true infinitely often.
